page.title: 04Churches, Eaton B & Edlesbor
page.content: The village churches in Eaton Bray and neighbouring Edlesborough were both built in the 13th century. St. Mary's, Edlesborough has been closed since the parishes merged in 1976. Built on an 'island hill', it is now in the care of the Redundant Churches Fund. An annual service is held, usually in July, when the church is decorated. Inside is a unique 'rose brass' and exceptional woodwork. St. Mary's, Eaton Bray, serves as the Parish Church for both villages, with a congregation of 104. It was built by William de Canteloupe in almost cathedral-like style. Sir Reginald Bray, from whom the village takes its name, rebuilt the tower. Three Methodist Chapels, a Strict Baptist Chapel and Salvation Army Corps each have small, but very loyal congregations.
